text: The Snow Girl
Once upon a time, a man and a woman lived in a little village.
They were sad because they had no children.
One winter day, they decided to play in the snow.
"Let's make a snow girl." said the woman.
"That sounds fun." said the man.
They gave her golden yarn for hair and blue stones for eyes.
"She's so beautiful!
I wish she were real," said the woman.
"I wish she were our daughter," said the man.
suddenly, the snow began to sparkle.
The yarn turned into golden hair.
The stones turned into blue eyes.
Snow Girl was alive!
"Amazing!" the woman said.
"Are you... are you alive?" the man asked.
"Yes, yes, I'm alive!'' she said.
"Will you be my mom and dad?"
"Of course, little Snow Girl," said the woman.
"Yes! We have a daughter!" the man shouted, and hugged her.
And so Snow Girl lived with them in the village.
One day, Snow Girl heard her mother make a wish.
"I wish I had a flower garden," she said.
Then Snow Girl began to sing:
Wind of winter, come to me.
A flower garden is what I see ...
And an icy flower garden appeared.
"Wow!" said her mother.
"It's beautiful. Thank you!"
She put a flower in Snow Girl's hair.
The next day, Snow Girl heard her father make a wish.
"I wish I could go ice fishing," he said.
Then Snow Girl began to sing:
Wind of winter, come to me.
An icy lake is what I see ...
And an icy lake full of fish appeared.
"Wow!" said her father.
"It's wonderful. Thank you!"
He went to catch fish for their dinner.
Later, Snow Girl heard some children make a wish.
"I wish we had a snow castle,' said a boy.
Then Snow Girl began to sing:
Wind of winter, come to me.
A great snow castle is what I see ...
And an icy snow castle appeared.
"Wow!" the children yelled.
"It's amazing! Come play with us, Snow Girl!"
They played in the castle for hours.
Everyone loved Snow Girl.
But the weather grew warmer and Snow Girl was sad.
"It's spring. I have to leave:' she said.
"You can't go!" cried her father.
"But I can't live without the winter:' Snow Girl replied.
"No! Don't go!" cried her mother.
"I'm sorry. I promise I'll be back!" said Snow Girl.
Then she began to cry, and her tears melted her.
"Oh, goodbye, goodbye!" her parents sobbed.
A warm wind blew, and Snow Girl was gone.
Through spring and summer and autumn, Snow Girl was gone.
But the next winter, when the first snow fell, Snow Girl returned.
"I'm home!" she yelled.
"You came back!" said the man.
"My little girl," said the woman, "we missed you."
"I love you," said Snow Girl.
"We love you, too," they said.
And every winter after that, they lived together, happily ever after.
